qas.question: How long ago did people start living in the area?
What agricultural job did people settling in the area perform?
What was an imported food that provided most of the carbohydrates?
What important protein helped with expansion of the inhabitants?
How long ago did farming force hunter-gatherer societies south?
What did dedertification allow for the expansion of?
What is production of alcoholic beverages an example of?
What did a Fish-stew revolution do to the group's eating habits?
What did farming of white yam allow for the transportation of?

context: <a0_0><b5_0>Approximately 10,000 years ago<b5_0/><a0_0/>, desertification forced hunter-gatherer societies south into the Sahel regions of northern Central Africa, where some groups settled and began <a1_0>farming<a1_0/> as part of the Neolithic Revolution. Initial farming of white yam progressed into millet and sorghum, and before 3000 BC the domestication of <a2_0>African oil palm<a2_0/> <b8_0>improved the groups' nutrition<b8_0/> and allowed for expansion of <b6_0>the local populations<b6_0/>. <a3_0>Bananas<a3_0/> arrived in the region and added an important source of carbohydrates to the diet; they were also used in the production of alcoholic beverages.[when?] This Agricultural Revolution, combined with a "<a4_0>Fish<a4_0/>-stew Revolution", in which fishing began to take place, and the use of boats, allowed for the transportation of <b9_0>goods<b9_0/>. Products were often moved in ceramic pots, which are the first known examples of <b7_0>artistic expression<b7_0/> from the region's inhabitants.
